When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $80$ is one place to the right of the same digit in the number $800$.


Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$800$ |$\searrow\purpleD{8}$ | $\searrow\blueD{0}$ | $\searrow\greenD{0}$  
$80$ | |$\purpleD8$ |$\blueD0$

Moving each digit to the right means dividing by $10$:  

$\purpleD8\blueD00\div10=\purpleD8\blueD0$ so,   

$\purpleD8\blueD00\div\purpleD8\blueD0=10$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |  :-:
$80$| |  $\swarrow\blueD8$ |$\swarrow\greenD{0}$ 
$10 \times 80$| $\blueD8$ | $\greenD0$ | $0$

$10 \times \blueD{8}\greenD{0} =\blueD8\greenD00$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |
$880$ | | $\swarrow\purpleD{8}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{8}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$  
$880 \times 10$ | $\purpleD{8}$ |$\blueD{8}$ |$\greenD0$ | $0$

$\purpleD8\blueD8\greenD0 \times 10=\purpleD8{,}\blueD8\greenD00$
